titlestmt.titleproper: Nowinski (Ira) Photographs of the Stanford Powwow
Guide to the Ira Nowinski Photographs of the Stanford Powwow PC0143
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-04-10 14:47:25 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Ira Nowinski photographs of the Stanford Powwow
did.abstract: Digitial images and select prints of the Stanford Powwow taken by Ira Nowinski.

accessrestrict.head: Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use. Audio-visual materials are not available in original format, and must be reformatted to a digital use copy.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Ira Nowinski is an American photographer of Polish and Hungarian Jewish descent. Born ca. 1942 and raised in New York, he was the first person in his family born in the United States. At the age of 42, he was prodded by opera singer Regina Resnick to do a photo essay around the Jewish milieu. He had previously done photo essays of the North Beach, San Francisco, area, of the evacuation of elderly citizens from hotels in the South of Market area of San Francisco, and of the Southeast Asian Community in the same city. In addition, he had been the staff photographer of the San Francisco Opera since 1978.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Stanford Powwow is held every Motherâ€™s Day Weekend in the Eucalyptus Grove on Stanford campus.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The materials consist of digitial images and select prints of the Stanford Powwow taken by Ira Nowinski.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ira Nowinski Photographs of the Stanford Powwow (PC0143). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Stanford University for materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator of this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Selection of sixteen 14x20" prints made and signed by Ira Nowinski.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Selection of twenty-seven 8x10" workprints made by Ira Nowinkski.
